ygData.subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Looking for Mana Sieve on Povar
ygData.msgSnippet: The one thing I ve run into at my current level (34) that is a problem are Burynai Cenobyte s.  I often pair with one other person and it s hard to keep them
ygData.messageBody:
The one thing I've run into at my current level (34) that is a problem are
Burynai Cenobyte's. I often pair with one other person and it's hard to
keep them stunned enough to interupt casting with the two of us so this is
one spell that seemed fun to try.

thanks,
Shawn

-----Original Message-----
From: Whitcraft,David [mailto:dwhitcraft@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 27, 2000 1:15 PM
To: 'eqenchanters@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Looking for Mana Sieve on Povar


Mobs have infinite mana unless they are fighting (agro) and then they have a
mana pool like PCs.

For example, the way to beat Lady Vox is to take 4-5 enchanters along chain
casting suckin her mana out once the battle has started. No mana, no
Complete Heal.... Outside of certain fights, I never used that line of
spells much.... Until your fighting mobs that are in the 50+ level range,
the fights go way too quickly to be effective IMO. And, different people
find different strategies useful. It's good for PvP...

-Leod, 56 Shaman
Dysin, 52 Enchanter
Zantaer, 43 Warrior
Fennin Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: (Uthanatos) [mailto:vtemplarv@...]
Sent: September 27, 2000 3:02 PM
To: eqenchanters@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Looking for Mana Sieve on Povar


How useful is Mana Sieve on MoBs in the game? Don't they have "infinite mana
syndrome"? I have been wondering this for a while now.

--
Uthanatos
8th Facet in the Gem of Norrath
Fennin

P.S. Evocation is horrid to get skill increases in. Jewel Crafting was
easier!
Fizzle...Fizzle...Fizzle...Fizzle...Fizzle...etc...Insuficcient mana to cast
this spell...grrrr...train 10 points into Evocation...repeat...*sigh*
